content: 1 granny hexi cardi pattern notes stitches used magic_ring chain chain half_double_crochet half_double_crochet double_crochet double_crochet yarn any weight yarn my black and neon sample used sock/fingering 1 weight yarn hook whichever hook gives you the texture you want my black and neon sample used a us h 5mm hook additonal thoughts one of the best things about this pattern is that it is very customizable you don t have to use dk weight yarn you can use any weight with its corresponding hook size if you use a thinner yarn it will take more time to get your row to size if you use a bulkier yarn it will work up faster in the gray class sample i used dk weight yarn with an i hook and it took about 600 yards of yarn with my black and neon sample i used 2 sock weight skeins of about 450 yards each and an h hook and used most of each skein of yarn another great thing is that you can really play with colors with this pattern you can do stripes by changing the color every round or you could use a gradient yarn that will change as you go if you want your two halves to match i recommend using two matching gradient cakes starting at the same place to start your center the great thing is that it is entirely customizable so you can play with color however you would like the most important part is that you have fun with this project and really enjoy the process stitch guide magic_ring create a magic_ring which is a size adjustable starting ring a good tutorial is found here https //sarahmaker com/crochet-magic-ring/ fasten_off fo fasten_off your stitch pull up the working loop and cut the yarn leaving a tail of 4-6 inches to be woven in 2 chain chain yarn over and pull through the loop on the hook slip_stitch slip_stitch insert hook in stitch yarn over and draw loop through stitch and loop on hook repeat from single_crochet single_crochet insert hook in stitch yarn over and pull up loop yarn over and draw through both loops on hook half_double_crochet half_double_crochet yarn over insert hook in stitch yarn over and pull a loop through stitch three loops on hook yarn over and draw through all the loops on the hook double_crochet double_crochet yarn over insert hook in stitch yarn over and pull up loop 3 loops on hook yarn over and draw through 2 loops yarn over and draw through remaining 2 loops corner cluster 3 double_crochet chain 2 3 double_crochet in same space edge cluster 3 double_crochet into an edge of the granny hexagon slip_stitch seam make a slipknot with seaming yarn and place on hook with rs of pieces facing each other *insert hook through both pieces of fabric under the stitch loops wrap yarn around hook to form a loop and pull loop back through both pieces of fabric and through the loop already on hook repeat
